intro: Molkenboeria membranacea, commonly known as the membranous molkenboeria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
